sub_topic: Identifying the perfect matching in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following undirected graph:

![Undirected Graph](https://i.imgur.com/Xh6mjY4.png)

Can you identify the perfect matching in this graph?
message_2:
A perfect matching in a graph is a set of edges such that every vertex is connected to exactly one edge in the set, and no two edges share a common vertex.

In the given graph, one possible perfect matching is:

- Edge connecting vertices 1 and 2
- Edge connecting vertices 3 and 4
- Edge connecting vertices 5 and 6

This perfect matching covers all the vertices, and each vertex is connected to exactly one edge in the set.
